questions.question_text: Which TLOC color is used for site-to-site communication in a Google Cloud integration with Cisco SD-WAN?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct:

Transport location (TLOC) color private1 is used only for site-to-site communication. Therefore, you should not use it for other interfaces.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/cloudonramp/ios-xe-17/cloud-onramp-book-xe/cloud-onramp-multi-cloud-google-cloud.html
Only option under consideration as per the question are A and C. But since the interface configuration should be on Spoke, Option C is correct

Selected Answer: C
Adaptative qos informations related to spoke should be configured on spoke side, than the hub is capable to adapt the tunnel policy at the fly. Then using Internet link it says so... C

Selected Answer: C
QoS should be configured on client side (spoke).
Answer is C. 
D is not correct as there is no MPLS

Selected Answer: C
Shouldn't this be C?
See --> color public-internet

Selected Answer: C
C.
It cannot be D as there is no MPLS

questions.question_text: Which plane builds and maintains the network topology and makes decisions on traffic flows?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
CP is correct.

C'mon cisco! So shutdown vs. no shutdown? 
Hello cisco, Is this a goal? To catch us on minor unrelated details?
A is correct, , cannot be B,C,D due to subint 6.2 is in shutdown state.

Selected Answer: A
"VRRP is only supported with service-side VPNs. If you are using subinterfaces, configure VRRP physical interfaces in VPN 0."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/system-interface/vedge-20-x/systems-interfaces-book/m-vrrp-tracking.html#Cisco_Concept.dita_884671ac-5066-411c-b736-da201aa0d261
That leaves A / C , as mentioned below C has subinterface in shutdown .
just a thought, has anyone else had an issue with this before where they needed to drop the MTU by 4 so the additional tag to be added. So setting the MTU to 1496 on the subinterface?

Selected Answer: A
a is correct. Agree with Outlaw

Selected Answer: C
is C. You should configure it on service VPN and if your are using dot1Q, then your physical interface should adapt the mtu.

Selected Answer: A
VRRP is configured under service VPN. In Options B and D there are VPN 0, which is transport VPN. So, remains A and C options. In option C ge0/6.3 is in shutdown state. So, option A is left. I'll go with A.

questions.question_text: An engineer must configure VRRP for redundancy on WAN Edge router 1 running an earlier version than 20.6, considering WAN Edge router2 is configured correctly. Which configuration meets the requirement?

choices.B: Authentication is 1024-bit key; encryption is AES-256 cipher, and integrity is ESP, HMAC-MD5.
choices.D: Authentication is 2048-bit key; encryption is AES-128 cipher, and integrity is ESP, HMAC-SHA1.
choices.C: Authentication is 2048-bit key; encryption is AES-256 cipher, and integrity is ESP, HMAC-SHA1.
choices.A: Authentication is 1024-bit key; encryption is AES-128 cipher, and integrity is ESP, HMAC-MD5.

questions.question_text: Which set of key security components of authentication, encryption, and integrity is used to establish an IPsec tunnel in the Cisco SD-WAN solution?

discussion.content:
Option C is correct. Check the control plan Encryption section on below link

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/security/vedge/security-book/security-overview.html
